replies.bodyText: explained it in GraphQL schema, where users access normally.
replies.author: hanahmily

replies.bodyText: I know it is there, and in the doc too. But this field should be highlight, and the rule should not be changed randomly. The comments help us to track if change happens.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Why always 1? According to your doc, 1 should mean unhealthy? I think you missed some codes.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Why always 1? According to your doc, 1 should mean unhealthy? I think you missed some codes.

This may be the initial status "unhealthy", and after the connection is established (line 142-145), the value should be set to 0, so I reckon the line at 149 should be healthChecker.setValue(0);? @hanahmily
replies.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText: Fixed with an asyn health check scheduler.
replies.author: hanahmily

timeline.bodyText: I don't think health guage requires the tag/value(s).
